pullRequest.title: Java-2824 fix tests in java 9 and above modules

commit.message: JAVA-2824 Fix tests in Java 9 and above modules
JAVA-2824 Fix tests in Java 9 and above modules

nodes.bodyText: I have removed the assertions on the number of modules. It's dependent on the JVM version, so we shouldn't test for it.
can we use the @Disabled annotation instead?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -48,7 +48,12 @@ public void shouldUseHttp2WhenWebsiteUsesHttp2() throws IOException, Interrupted
         assertThat(response.version(), equalTo(HttpClient.Version.HTTP_2));
     }
 
-    @Test
+    /*
+    * This test will fail as soon as the given URL returns a HTTP 2 response.
+    * Therefore, let's leave it commented out.
+    * */
+
+   /* @Test

nodes.bodyText: have the assertions changed because the Java version has been upgraded? I just want to understand if we are asserting the correct data.
can we add a reason why these tests will not work and disabled them instead of removing?
I think in this case we can rename the entire test to *ManualTest?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -50,19 +50,27 @@ public void givenRunningTask_whenMeasuringTimeWithStopWatch_thenGetElapsedTime()
         
         assertEquals(true, (2000L <= timeElapsed) && (timeElapsed <= 3000L));
     }
-    
-    @Test
+
+    /*
+     The below test depends on the elapsed time, which isn't ideal in a test.
+     Also, it slows down test execution artificially.
+     */
+    /*@Test

nodes.bodyText: is this change intended for this PR?
We are killing a "random" process. This can work or no, depending on if that process exists or not. Most likely it doesn't exist, so the test fails.
